sense.def:
To sit
pomeni biti v takem položaju, da težo telesa podpira zadnjica, ne pa stopala.

seg.quote: She was sitting on the edge of the bed.

sense.def:
To sit
pomeni spustiti telo na sedež ali podlago, na kateri bomo sedeli.

seg.quote: He came into the room and sat in his usual chair.

sense.def:
To sit an examination
pomeni delati izpit;

To sit on a committee
pomeni biti član nekega odbora.

seg.quote: Representatives of the workers should sit on the board of directors.
Visitors are only allowed in on days when the Houses are not sitting.
The little parish church sits cosily in the middle of the village.

sense.def:
To sit tight
pomeni ostati, kjer smo, in ne ukrepati.

seg.quote: All they have to do is sit tight until the Republic recognises their claims.

sense.def:
To sit back
pomeni sprostiti se in ne poseči v dogajanje;

seg.quote: He believes he has the right to sit back while others do the hard work.

sense.def:
To sit down
ali
to sit oneself down
pomeni spustiti telo na sedež ali drugo površino, na kateri bomo sedeli.

seg.quote: He sat down on the edge of the bed.

sense.def:
To sit in on a meeting
pomeni spremljati potek sestanka, vendar ne sodelovati v razpravah.

seg.quote: I was allowed to sit in on the deliberations of the board.

sense.def:
To sit something out
pomeni čakati, da se nekaj konča, in v tem času ne ukrepati.

seg.quote: They would retire to their caves to sit out the winter.

sense.def:
To sit up
pomeni dvigniti telo v sedeč položaj, če smo prej ležali ali bili naslonjeni nazaj.

seg.quote: She sat up in bed when she saw him coming.

sense.def:
To sit up all night
pomeni ne iti spat.

seg.quote: Sometimes I sit up reading until three or four in the morning.
